text: Ranjit Bhatia OBE (c. 1936 â€“ 9 February 2014) was an Indian athlete. He ran in the marathon and 5000 meters events at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome. Bhatia studied at the Lawrence School, Sanawar.Prabhsharan Singh Kang, Leadership through Initiative and Innovation A Case Study on Sanawar at sirtaj.net, accessed 7 March 2012 He was then a Rhodes scholar at Oxford University, matriculating at Jesus College in 1957. He retired as Reader in Mathematics from St. Stephen's College, Delhi. Bhatia died on 9 February 2014 at the age of 77. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Indian athletes
title: Ranjit Bhatia
